revised_title: Description and Behavior of the American Hummingbird
tldr: The author, Nehemiah Grew, describes the physical characteristics, behavior, and habitat of the American hummingbird, also known as the Tomineius. He discusses their small size, green color, feeding habits, and lack of singing abilities. Grew also mentions the hummingbird's solitary nature and the appearance of their wings when viewed through a small bird's wing.
